meanings.definition: Emitting energy in the form of waves or particles
meanings.sent1: The sun felt warm and radiating on my skin.
meanings.sent2: The radiating heat from the fire kept us warm.
meanings.sent3: The radiating smile on her face brightened up the room.
meanings.sent4: His radiating enthusiasm for the project was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The radiating light from the lighthouse guided the ships safely.

meanings.sent1: The flashlight had a radiating beam that cut through the darkness.
meanings.sent2: The radiating colors of the sunset painted the sky beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The radiating laser pointer entertained the cat for hours.
meanings.sent4: Her radiating gaze locked onto his eyes from across the room.
meanings.sent5: The radiating spotlight shone on the lead singer during the concert.

meanings.definition: Spreading out from a central point
meanings.sent1: The roads in the city were radiating from the main square.
meanings.sent2: The radiating cracks on the windshield needed immediate repair.
meanings.sent3: The radiating lines on the map showed the directions to different places.
meanings.sent4: Her radiating laughter filled the entire room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The radiating branches of the tree provided shade on a hot day.
